meanings.definition: Remove water from (a construction site, mine, etc.) to make it dry.
meanings.sent1: The workers are dewatering the construction site to prevent flooding.
meanings.sent2: They use pumps for dewatering flooded areas after heavy rain.
meanings.sent3: Why did the sponge go to school? To learn about dewatering!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like dewatering a swamp, slowly but surely making progress.
meanings.sent5: The sun's heat dewatering the wet clothes hanging on the line was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The process of removing water from something.
meanings.sent1: The dewatering of the basement was necessary after the pipe burst.
meanings.sent2: The dewatering of the soil improved the conditions for planting crops.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fascination with dewatering the fish tank was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: His words had a dewatering effect on her tears, calming her down instantly.
meanings.sent5: The dewatering of the lake revealed long-lost treasures hidden beneath the surface.
